definition: a basket carried on the back
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: For a long waiting, he put down the basket, and sat on the ground directly, continuing.
sentences.chinese: 等久了，就把背篓往地上一放，坐着等。

sentences.english: One survivor walked out of town carrying a washing machine in a basket on his back.
sentences.chinese: 一个幸存者走出县城，背篓里装着一台洗衣机。

sentences.english: As used on the little hand, picking the one into a basket carried on the back, as if tireless.
sentences.chinese: 就那样用小手，一枚一枚的捡进背篓，仿佛不知疲倦。

sentences.english: Mrs. Youfu puts down the basket, dusts her clothes and pretends to be angry.
sentences.chinese: 又福嫂放下背篓，拍打着衣服，佯作生气。

definition: bamboo, rattan or wicker basket/sedan chair for mountain use (Cantonese)
cloth pouch open in the middle, forming two bags/jacket worn for Chinese wrestling
